trans-unit.source: The Acquisitions report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see who has acquired your app, along with demographic and platform details.
trans-unit.target: The Acquisitions report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see who has acquired your app, along with demographic and platform details.

trans-unit.source: Acquisitions report
trans-unit.target: Acquisitions report

trans-unit.source: Acquisitions report
trans-unit.target: Acquisitions report

trans-unit.source: The **Acquisitions** report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see who has acquired your app, along with demographic and platform details.
trans-unit.target: The **Acquisitions** report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see who has acquired your app, along with demographic and platform details.

trans-unit.source: You can view this data in your dashboard, or [download the report](download-analytic-reports.md) to view offline.
trans-unit.target: You can view this data in your dashboard, or [download the report](download-analytic-reports.md) to view offline.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can programmatically retrieve this data by using the [Windows Store analytics REST API](../monetize/access-analytics-data-using-windows-store-services.md).
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can programmatically retrieve this data by using the [Windows Store analytics REST API](../monetize/access-analytics-data-using-windows-store-services.md).

trans-unit.source: In this report, an acquisition means a new customer has obtained a license to your app (whether you charged money or you've offered it for free).
trans-unit.target: In this report, an acquisition means a new customer has obtained a license to your app (whether you charged money or you've offered it for free).

trans-unit.source: **Important** The **Acquisitions** report does not include data about refunds, reversals, chargebacks, etc. To estimate your app proceeds, visit [Payout summary](payout-summary.md).
trans-unit.target: **Important** The **Acquisitions** report does not include data about refunds, reversals, chargebacks, etc. To estimate your app proceeds, visit [Payout summary](payout-summary.md).

trans-unit.source: In the **Reserved** section, click the **Download reserved transactions** link.
trans-unit.target: In the **Reserved** section, click the **Download reserved transactions** link.

trans-unit.source: Apply filters
trans-unit.target: Apply filters

trans-unit.source: Near the top of the page, you can expand **Apply filters** to filter all of the data on this page by date range and/or by device type.
trans-unit.target: Near the top of the page, you can expand **Apply filters** to filter all of the data on this page by date range and/or by device type.

trans-unit.source: **Date**: The default filter is **Last 30 days**, but you can expand this up to **Last 12 months**.
trans-unit.target: **Date**: The default filter is **Last 30 days**, but you can expand this up to **Last 12 months**.

trans-unit.source: **Device type**: The default setting is **All devices**.
trans-unit.target: **Device type**: The default setting is **All devices**.

trans-unit.source: If you want to show data for acquisitions from a certain device type only, you can choose a specific one here.
trans-unit.target: If you want to show data for acquisitions from a certain device type only, you can choose a specific one here.

trans-unit.source: The info in the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the **Apply filters** section.
trans-unit.target: The info in the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the **Apply filters** section.

trans-unit.source: The info in all of the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the **Apply filters** section.
trans-unit.target: The info in all of the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the **Apply filters** section.

trans-unit.source: By default this will include data for all device types, unless you've used **Apply filters** to choose only one.
trans-unit.target: By default this will include data for all device types, unless you've used **Apply filters** to choose only one.

trans-unit.source: Acquisitions
trans-unit.target: Acquisitions

trans-unit.source: The **Acquisitions** chart shows the number of daily or weekly acquisitions of your app over the selected period of time.
trans-unit.target: The **Acquisitions** chart shows the number of daily or weekly acquisitions of your app over the selected period of time.

trans-unit.source: (When you use **Apply filters** to filter the data over a longer duration, the data will be grouped by week.)
trans-unit.target: (When you use **Apply filters** to filter the data over a longer duration, the data will be grouped by week.)

trans-unit.source: You can also see the lifetime number of acquisitions for your app.
trans-unit.target: You can also see the lifetime number of acquisitions for your app.

trans-unit.source: This shows the cumulative total of all acquisitions, starting from when your app was first published.
trans-unit.target: This shows the cumulative total of all acquisitions, starting from when your app was first published.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally filter the results by market and/or by OS version.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally filter the results by market and/or by OS version.

trans-unit.source: Customer demographic
trans-unit.target: Customer demographic

trans-unit.source: The **Customer demographic** chart shows demographic info about the people who acquired your app.
trans-unit.target: The **Customer demographic** chart shows demographic info about the people who acquired your app.

trans-unit.source: You can see how many acquisitions (over the selected period of time) were made by people in a certain age group and by which gender.
trans-unit.target: You can see how many acquisitions (over the selected period of time) were made by people in a certain age group and by which gender.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Some customers have opted not to share this info.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Some customers have opted not to share this info.

trans-unit.source: If we were unable to determine the age group or gender, the acquisition is categorized as **Unknown**.
trans-unit.target: If we were unable to determine the age group or gender, the acquisition is categorized as **Unknown**.

trans-unit.source: Markets
trans-unit.target: Markets

trans-unit.source: The **Markets** chart shows the total number of acquisitions over the selected period of time by market.
trans-unit.target: The **Markets** chart shows the total number of acquisitions over the selected period of time by market.

trans-unit.source: By default, we show you the market which had the most acquisitions on top and continue downward from there.
trans-unit.target: By default, we show you the market which had the most acquisitions on top and continue downward from there.

trans-unit.source: You can reverse this order by toggling the arrow in the **Acquisitions** column of this chart.
trans-unit.target: You can reverse this order by toggling the arrow in the **Acquisitions** column of this chart.

trans-unit.source: OS version
trans-unit.target: OS version

trans-unit.source: The **OS version** chart shows the total number of acquisitions based on the customer's operating system (or via [volume acquisition by organizations](organizational-licensing.md)).
trans-unit.target: The **OS version** chart shows the total number of acquisitions based on the customer's operating system (or via [volume acquisition by organizations](organizational-licensing.md)).

trans-unit.source: In some cases we may not be able to determine this info.
trans-unit.target: In some cases we may not be able to determine this info.

trans-unit.source: In that case, the OS version will be listed as **Unknown**.
trans-unit.target: In that case, the OS version will be listed as **Unknown**.
